'''''airë''''' (alt. '''''aira'''''<ref name=Shibb>{{PM|Shibboleth}}, pp. 363-364, note 45</ref>) is a [[Quenya]] adjective meaning "holy".<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, p. 67</ref>

It also appears as a noun: ''airë-'' is glossed as "holiness",<ref name=PE17/> ''airë'' (''airē'') is glossed as "sanctity, holiness",<ref name=Eldarin>{{PE|Eldarin}}, p. 149</ref> and ''airë'' is glossed as "sanctity".<ref name=Shibb/>

It is said that the [[Eldar]] used the word ''Airë'' as a title of address to the [[Valar]] and greater [[Maiar]].<ref name=PE17/> An example is [[Varda]], who was addressed as ''Airë [[Tári]]'', the "holy queen"<ref name=Shibb/> (see also ''airetári'' in [[Namárië|Galadriel's Lament]]<ref>{{RGEO|Namarie}}, line 7</ref>).

==Etymology==
*[[Sundocarme|Root]] [[AYA]]<ref name=Eldarin/>

==Examples==
*''[[Airefëa|'''Aire'''fëa]]'' = "Holy Spirit"
*''[[Airë Tári|'''Airë''' Tári]]'' = "Holy Queen"
*''[[Anairë|An'''airë''']]'' = "Holiest"
*''[[Átaremma|na airë esselya]]'' = "hallowed be thy name"
